title: Licence & Acknowledgements
text:
Acknowledgements
Some materials are adapted from:

Data Science in a Box by Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel (github repo) under a Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike 4.0 International licence
a blogpost by Cédric Scherer under a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International licence.

Others draw on R for Data Science (2nd ed.) by Hadley Wickham, Mine Çetinkaya-Rundel and Garrett Grolemund.
See individual files for details.

title: Introduction to Data Science
text: Instructor: Prof. Ina Bornkessel-Schlesewsky (University of South Australia; Global Faculty member, University of Cologne)

title: About the course
text:
You will be introduced to coding in R, an open-source programming language for statistical computing, during this workshop. After introducing basic concepts of data exploration and visualisation within a reproducible workflow, the course will touch on more advanced aspects of data “wrangling” including working with text.
Textbook: Wickham, Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Grolemund (2023) – freely available online here
Prerequisites: None. Please bring a laptop.




References

Wickham, Hadley, Mina Çetinkaya-Rundel, and Garrett Grolemund. 2023. R for Data Science. 2nd ed. O’Reilly Media, Inc. https://www.oreilly.com/library/view/r-for-data/9781492097396/.
